H0.text: Continental drift is the process by which movements in the mantle cause tectonic plates to move over time.

H1.text: Continental expansion is the process by which movements in the mantle cause the plates to move over time.

H2.text: Continental shift is the process by which movements in the mantle cause plates to move over time.

H3.text: Boundary drift is the process by which movements in the mantle cause the tectonic plates to move over time.

A4.text: Similar plant and animal fossils are found around the shores of different continents, suggesting that they were once joined.

A5.text: Evidence for the movement of continents on tectonic plates is now extensive.
